text:
="preserve">Claude Moisy (26 June 1927 – 21 September 2020) was a French journalist and writer. He was President of the Agence France-Presse from 1990 to 1993. He was born in Caen, France. Moisy began his journalistic career with "Ouest-France". Moisy joined Reporters Without Borders. He also worked for "Le Monde".
Moisy died on 21 September 2020 at the age of 93.
